values: RCA4 is the latest fourth generation of the Rossby Centre regional climate model RCA, based on the numerical weather prediction model HIRLAM. The RCA4 has a hydrostatic dynamical core with 40 model levels in the hybrid vertical coordinate. The RCA4 employs a tile-based land surface scheme with physiography based on ECOCLIMAP and the Flake lake model with prognostic lake ice.
The first year of the evaluation (1979) and historical (1969) simulations is a spin-up.

Strandberg G., Bärring L., Hansson U., Jansson C., Jones C., Kjellström E., Kupiainen M., Nikulin G., Samuelsson P., Ullerstig A., 2015. CORDEX scenarios for Europe from the Rossby Centre regional climate model RCA4. Report Meteorology and Climatology, 116, Swedish Meteorological and Hydrological Institute (SMHI), 84 p. https://www.smhi.se/en/publications/cordex-scenarios-for-europe-from-the-rossby-centre-regional-climate-model-rca4-1.90274 ; Samuelsson, P., Gollvik, S., Jansson, C., Kupiainen, M., Kourzeneva, E., van de Berg, W.J., 2015. The surface processes of the Rossby Centre regional atmospheric climate model (RCA4). Meteorologi, 157, Swedish Meteorological and Hydrological Institute (SMHI), p. 58. https://www.smhi.se/en/publications/the-surface-processes-of-the-rossby-centreregional-atmospheric-climate-model-rca4-1.89801
